element.name: The Pepper Canister by Hezekiah, Traditional Cache (1/1)

center.font: Visit the new Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE

long-description.p: St. Stephen's Church, also known as The Pepper Canister Church or the Pepper Pot Church was the last of a series of Georgian Churches built by the Church of Ireland. This "Gem of Dublin" is situated on Mount Street Crescent and is well worth a visit.
St. Stephen's holds concerts and events in which world wide acts, mainly choirs and bands, perform in front of an in house audience.

element.encoded-hints: It's attracted to the railings opposite no. 2 Herbert Street!

ul.li:
2010-06-14T19:00:00Z : Found it by scheff
Together with sina1507 we started our holiday in Dublin today with geocaching. TFTC scheff from Germany

2010-06-14T19:00:00Z : Found it by sina1507
First cache to find in Dublin! Together with scheff we started our in holiday in Dublin today with geocaching. TFTC sina1507 from Germany

2010-06-12T19:00:00Z : Found it by THE_Chris
Easy find with the hint, however on my GPSMap60csx anyway, the posted coordinates were over 15m out, putting the cache in a house. Nice spot though.

2010-06-02T19:00:00Z : Found it by Frigo
Found it on my visit in Dublin. Thank you for this cache.
Greetings Frigo

2010-05-26T19:00:00Z : Found it by tmob
#2439
We looked for this cache during our holidays in Ireland. Six fantastic days, 1800kms driven, and a bunch of caches found. Definitely a great way to get to know this beautiful island!
On our way back to the hotel, this was the last cache today. The hint was very helpful.
Thanks for this one... Greetings from Portugal

2009-11-16T20:00:00Z : Found it by Kersti.com
Found on a very cold and windy Monday night with JME1979. Surprisingly large for this area but well hidden enough.

St. Stephen's holds concerts and events in which world wide acts, mainly choirs and bands, perform in front of an in house audience.
